timeline.message:
GEODE-7851: Pulse Oauth Support

* create an OauthSecurityConfig to configure spring using oauth
* add PULSE as one of the oauth-enabled-component, and if pulse is set to use oauth, set the OauthSecurityConfig as the active security profile
* use pulse.properties in the locator's working dir to externalize pulse authentication provider configuration

Co-authored-by: Dale Emery <demery@pivotal.io>
Co-authored-by: Joris Melchior <jmelchior@pivotal.io>

delete unnecessary test file

timeline.bodyText: this code repeats "spring.profiles.active" four times. Consider changing it to just call System.setProperty once (at the end). You could introduce a localvar "String activeProfileValue" and have each of these lines set that local var.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: Since you only use "pulseOauth" inside the if(isIntegratedSecurity) would it be better to initialize the variable inside that if?
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: It looks like we only have uaa support here. So if a customer is using oauth2 will it only work with uaa or can the configure it for some other oauth2 authentication server?
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: actually that name can be changed
replies.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to add something here to take of where the app goes after logging out? For OAuth this should be different from Default or Gemfire flows I believe.
timeline.author: jmelchio

replies.bodyText: In your test, what does it do?
replies.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText:
Does this PR need to update some of the doc files to describe how to configure pulse to use oauth2?

Yes, I will add a task to the tracker story to update the doc. PR for that is to be followed.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText:
In your test, what does it do?

Don't have that covered in test yet but it follows the logoutHandler set up in the DefaultSecurityConfig. In the OAuth case I think it should invalidate the token someway. I assume there is a built-in way that Spring handles this so we should try to make use of that.
replies.author: jmelchio

replies.bodyText: In this changeset, I have OauthSecurityConfig directly extends WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter. It does not use anything defined in DefaultSecurityConfig. So I hope spring would pick up the flow.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: It looks as if this uses the /management API itself to somehow mimic UAA (or some other OAuth server). How does that work?
timeline.author: demery-pivotal

replies.bodyText: this changeset only makes sure pulse can be configured to talk to an authorizationUri. Whatever happens after that, is going to be in Joris's PR.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText:
As the test comment states "this test just makes sure the property file in the locator's working dir
gets properly read and used in the oauth security configuration". so it only makes sure the configuration in the property file gets used by Pulse, exactly where that URI points to, is irrelavant.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: Why only once? This looks fragile: If someone changes the page to show these words more than once, the test will fail, even if the request redirects properly.
timeline.author: demery-pivotal

replies.bodyText: This is a random URL I picked up only for testing purpose. I happen to pick the /management uri, which returns json content {"latest":"...", "supported":[...]}. It is just a way to test the redirect works. It's not likely that url response would change and if it does, yes, developer will need to change the test.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText:
Why only once? This looks fragile: If someone changes the page to show these words more than once, the test will fail, even if the request redirects properly.

From what I know that is highly unlikely. I think it is safe in this case.
replies.author: jmelchio

replies.bodyText: Each assertion should express a requirement that the test cares about. "Only once" is not a requirement here. Fix it.
replies.author: demery-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: Capitalize the A in OAuth (here and elsewhere)
timeline.author: demery-pivotal

timeline.bodyText:
xyz.com is an actual domain name. Please use a test-specific domain name such as:

example.com (example.com is intended mostly for documentation, but people use it for testing)
<any-subdomain>.test (.test is a special top-level domain name designed for testing)
<any-subdomain>.example (.example is another special top-level domain name)
timeline.author: demery-pivotal
